oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Brass case for razor blades
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This is a small brass case used for storing safety razor blades and is marked "Gillette" within an elongated lozenge and motto "KNOWN THE WORLD OVER." Two razor blades are contained within. The case was found inside Gwjack 049. The case belonged to Sgt. Connie Marshall Williams, Co. E, 306th Engineer Regt. King C. Gillette invented the "safety razor" in 1903. During World War I the razors were issued to all US servicemen. Their popularity ended the use of the straight razor by most American men.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
